**Title**
Enterprise Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) Request for Proposal – BPM021339

**Status**
Expired, as of July 13, 2024

**Description**
The Government of Canada (GC) invites eligible respondents to submit a proposal for the procurement of an enterprise-grade Customer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) solution, delivered as a Service as a Software (SaaS). The selected contractor will be an Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM).

**Scope**
The CIAM solution must accommodate the requirement of the GC and its clients, including individuals and businesses, at large. The solution will be deployed in a SaaS model, and the contractor must be an OEM.

**Evaluation Criteria**
The evaluation process will be based on a High Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price. Negotiations may be conducted with any qualified respondent related to this procurement.

**Security Requirements**
This RFQ (Request for Quote) contains security requirements.

**Submission Requirements**
Respondents must submit their bids using the Shared Services Canada’s Procure-to-Pay (P2P) system.

**Trade Agreements**
The following trade agreements apply to this procurement process:

* Canadian Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-GPA)

**Amendment Information**
This tender announcement is Amendment 000 to the original Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP).

**Implementation Details**
The initial contract period is 10 years, with 5 one-year option periods. The duration of the contract will be negotiated with the selected contractor.

**Key Personnel**
Please contact James Taylor-Chassé at james.taylor-chasse@ssc-spc.gc.ca for clarification on this tender announcement.
